1.c: Some distance to school. Part south and southwest side and southeast side not in city limits. Several industrial plants along Denton Drive. Municipal arport in center of area. Unpaved streets.
1.b: Bus transportation adequate. Business center in area. Lake on northwest side. Has all public utilities.

2.a: Clerical, facory workers, mechanics, laborers

areaDesc.5: About 30 new houses built within past 12 months in Northern part of area between Love Field Drive and Bachman's Lake, along Wylie Drive, Noyes, Weiss and Reeves, and Shore Crest Drive. Also some new buildings of small houses West of Denton Drive. Southeast part of area contains many smaller houses occupied by factory workers. Airport is being extended toward southeast and it is anticipated that streets will be closed for two or three blocks in this direction, but not many houses to be razed and all only small cheapplaces.

1.c: Distance to principal business center. Unpaved streets. Interurban line through part of area.
1.b: Has all city conveniences, schools, churches and stores in area. Bus transportation.

2.a: Clerical, skilled mechanics small merchants

areaDesc.5: Northern part east of Beckley better part of area. Higher priced new construction north of Vermont and between Marsalis & Ramsey. Cheaper new construction is west of Beckley. On Beckley at Iowa & Georgia bordering street car line is worst part of area.

1.c: Distance to center of city.
1.b: School in area. All city conveniences. Fairly convenient to stores and churches. Bus transportation.

2.a: Clerical, junior executives business & professional

areaDesc.5: This is an area bordered on all sides by high class residential sections except north which is vacant and future development will be in keeping present area and surroundings. Has deed restrictions.

1.c: Some distance to city grade and high schools. Distance to principal business center. Poor approach to main business district. Surrounded on two sides by cheaper properties. Unpaved streets.
1.b: Adequate transportation. All city conveniences. Community business center in area.

2.a: Clerical, business, and professional men

areaDesc.5: Best part of area is East of Superior Street. A well established area of small brick and frame cottages, well occupied, and evidencing pride of ownership.

1.c: Surrounding area. Small Industrial Area on Southwest.
1.b: Adequate bus transportation. School in area. All city conveniences. Stores not distant.

2.a: Clerical, business and professional men

areaDesc.5: In southeastern part of this area located two or three large, expensive estates valued as high as $65,000. Remainder of area a nice section uniformly designed and with uniform construction.

1.c: Inadequate transportation in Eastern part as street car line stops at BeemanAve. Schools not very close - Community business on East Grand which is some distance from Eastern part of area.
1.b: All city conveniences. Park joins on North. Western part of area has adequate transportation and fairly convenient to stores schools.

2.a: Clerical, Mechanics & Merchants

areaDesc.5: Just a fair area, mixed type of construction, lower grade area bordering on South and West and undeveloped land in East.

1.c: Encroachment of commercial and industrial establishments, junk yards and second hand auto parts stores. Cheaply constructed houses. Type of population.
1.b: Close to business center. Schools, churches, stores in area. All city conveniences. Adequate transportation. Small park in area.

2.a: Laborers, factory workers, clerical, small business men

a.2: Singles-8/12 rs. and includes duplexed and some few apt. units

areaDesc.5: The entire area is a transition from residential to industrial, commercial and apartment houses. As a residential area the portion the greatest distance from the business center is the better part.

1.c: Type of population. Surrounding area.
1.b: Schools, stores in area. All city conveniences. Adequate transportation. Uniform type of construction.

2.a: Merchants,professional men - executives - clerical

areaDesc.5: This area contains a much better type of property than surrounding area, practically all brick and well maintained. Population is largely composed of middle class Jews, and is inclining towards a lower-grade. Ordinarily this would be classed as a 2nd grade area, but due to location, surroundings and tendency to infiltration of lower grade population is is brought down to a high "C".

1.c: Fort Worth Highway through center of area along which is located tourist camps, small drink & lunch stands, illing stations. Unpaved streets.
1.b: Has all city conveniences, adequate transportation. School in area.

2.a: Oil refinery workers, clerical

areaDesc.5: Section south of Fort Worth Highway largely vacant. Part of area North of Highway contains residential development. Reason for increase in value since 1929 is fact that Fort Worth Highway was not opened until 1932 and prior to that time transportation facilities were inadequate and demand for propery in this section was almost nil.

1.c: Lack of transportation, distance to schools, churches and stores, and principal business center, but type of development and population offsets these influences.
1.b: Uniformity of construction. All city conveniences.

2.a: Executives, business and professional men, capitalists.

areaDesc.5: This is a highly developed subdivision outside city limits which was particularly designed for expensive suburban homes. That part west highway 116 is of the very highest type containing many of homes in the edifice classification. Some expensive types of cottages in northeastern area.

1.c: Distance from center of city. Unproved area on west. No restrictions except zoning.
1.b: Uniformity of construction. Conveniently located to school. Good approach. Bus transportation. All city conveniences.

2.a: Clerical some business and professional men

areaDesc.5: A small well balanced area, containing a better type of improvements than surrounding area.

1.c: Lack of adequate transportation. Distance to schools and churches and community business center. Loss of activity in subdivision.
1.b: Uniformity of construction. Country Club and Golf Course joins on South. Has all city conveniences. High elevation.

2.a: Clerical and small merchants

areaDesc.5: A fairly uniform area started about 11 years ago but because of lack of promotional ability of subdividers, activity past few years has been almost dead.

1.c: Outside city limits.
1.b: Near White Rock Lake. Well planned subdivision originally highly restricted. Natural beauty. Bus transportation. Has all city conveniences.

2.a: Business & professional/ men

p.1: Not sufficient rental property to create demand

areaDesc.5: Original developer of this subdivision committed suicide and for a few years activity was slow. However, by reason of deed restrictions, location, type of construction and natural beauty area will remain good, and present building activity will in all probability rapidly increase.

1.c: Distance to principal business center. Railroad track on Northeast line. Small industrial plants across railroad on Northeast
1.b: School in area. Stores close. Uniformity of construction. New subdivision. Adequate bus transportation.

2.a: Clerical, skilled mechanics, small merchants

areaDesc.5: Aside from the older houses this area is being improved uniformly. Majority of structures conforming with F. H. A. specifications.

1.c: Outside city limits. Some distance to stores and school but bus pickup for school children. Transportation inadequate.
1.b: Attractive design of subdivision - large lots - attractive contour. All city conveniences. Fair building restrictions.

2.a: Clerical, business and professional men merchants

p.1: to 40 Fair because of inadequate transportation

areaDesc.5: A subdivision platted several years ago that experienced rapid growth for a short time only, retarded due to sitance from center of city and economic conditions. it is attractively designed containing many lots of natural beauty. Very little rental property in the area.

1.c: Inadequate transportation. Distance to principal business center. Unpaved streets. Mixed construction. Large Cocao Cola plant being constructed adjoining area on south.
1.b: Schools and stores in area, city conveniences.

2.a: Negro laborers and domestics

areaDesc.5: An area occupied exclusively by negroes with vacant property on all sides. New plant of Coca Cola Bottling Company being constructed adjoining on south. Very little likelihood of any chance in the area in the near future.

1.c: Railroad track, encroachment of small industrial plants, unpaved streets and general mixture of construction. City hospital in area.
1.b: All city conveniences, schools, churches and stores in area. Adequate transportation.

2.a: Laborers, mechanics, clerical, small merchants, some professional men, etc.

areaDesc.5: Part of area southeast of St. L. & S.W. R.R. and extreme northeast corner best part of area. Part along railroad traks west of Sylvester St. is worst part. On Maple Ave. at Lucas St. is located Cedar Spring Place, Government low-cost housing projest. It contains 181 units, has been open one year and all units are reported occupied. Several large, expensive old homes in southeast corner on Turtle Creek Blvd.

1.c: Many apartment houses and duplexes in the area - age of properties. Some unpaved streets. Several boarding and rooming houses in area. Encroachment of business.
1.b: Grade School, churches, community business center in area. Adequate transportation. All city conveniences.

2.a: Clerical, business and professional men and skilled mechanics

areaDesc.5: Prescott, Hawthorne & Herschel best streets. Apartment houses and duplexes scattered throughout area. Cheaper area along southwestern line.

1.c: Type of population. Old cheap houses predominate. Encroachment of commercial and industrial establishments.
1.b: Close to business center. Schools, churches, stores in area. Adequate transportation.

2.a: Common laborers

areaDesc.5: This area adjoins commercial and industrial section. Almost no sales as properties are being held as future business and industrial sites.

1.c: Railroad tracks through area, cemetary in area. Mixtures of population and type of construction. Encroachment of commercial and industrial establishments, rooming houses.
1.b: Schools, churches, stores in area. Adequate transportation. All city conveniences. Near principal business district.

2.a: Laborers, clerical, small merchants, etc.

areaDesc.5: Better part of area is southeast corner & northeast corner. A general mixture of most every type of old property and also population. Thomas and State streets best negro streets.

1.c: Railroad tracks through part of area. Old properties. 2 Industrial plants - many large apartments houses of varying degrees of desirability. No restrictions except zoning.
1.b: High schools, grade schools, churches, stores in area. Adequate transportation. All city convenciences. Park in area.

2.a: laborers, clerical, professional and business men

areaDesc.5: Better apartments on N. Fitzhugh,Ross, Bryan, Live Oak, Mosher, Bennett, Garrett & Tremint. Older apartments on Carroll, Annex, Ashby & Peak. Best cottage area on Henderson, Garrett, Belmont, Milam & Alcott. Larger 2 story houses scattered. On N. Fitzhugh, across from Mission, an apartment project of 96 units consisting of about 12 seperate buildings, financed by FHA insured mortgage, has just been completed and opened for occupancy this year.

1.e: Static to upward in eastern part.
1.c: Western portion contains many structures becoming obsolete on account of age.
1.b: Uniformity of construction. Adequate transportation. All city conveniences. Grade schools not far distant. Golf course on east.

2.a: Executive, business and professional men

areaDesc.5: West of Greenville is older part except in Northern border, which is new. Eastern part of area has had much activity in new construction during past few years and it is continuing. This entire area is protected by deed restrictions which have several years yet to run. It will continue to be desirable and sales activity will conmtinue to be good in east portion. All land in thie area has been platted.

1.c: Mixed type of construction - encroachment of commercial and industrial establishments.
1.b: Schools, churches, stores in area. All city conveniences. Adequate transportation. Parks in area.

2.a: Clerical, professional,small merchants, skilled mechanics, etc.

areaDesc.5: On Garland, Perry, Gurley, Ash Lane, Terry for about 3 blocks on each side of Fitzhugh is better part of area. Southeastern and southern portion worst part of area.

1.c: Encroachment of commercial and industrial establishments. Railroad tracks through area. Mixed type of population and construction.
1.b: Park in area, schools, churches and stores. Close to business center. All city conveniences. Adequate transportation.

2.a: Laborers, factor workers, clerical

a.2: Singles 8/12 rs. & includes large old houses made into duplexes

areaDesc.5: Portion of area surrounding city park is best part of area. Negro population in northeastern part and southern tip. Harwood Park Row, Northeast end of Beaumont, Pocahontas, Gayne are better streets.

1.c: Outside city limits and distance to principal business center. Poor transportation.
1.b: High elevation. Golf course joining. New subdivision. Has all city conveniences.

2.a: Clerical Small merchants

areaDesc.5: This is a new subdivision with only about 20 homes in it. It is owned by one of the large banks in Dallas and is now being pushed by it. It is frequently advertised in in the newspapers, and efforts to create sales demand are meeting with some success due to new construction of modern design and ultra convenient arrangements.

1.c: Mixed type of construction and population. Unpaved streets. Cemetary in southeastern part of area.
1.b: All city conveniences, schools, churches, stores in area. Adequate transportation.

2.a: Clerical, laborers, skilled and unskilled, some small business men.

areaDesc.5: An area of old houses, not well kept, mixed population, unpaved streets, with practically no outstanding features in its favor.

1.c: Cheap construction - type of population - unpaved streets. Railroad tracks through area - with some industrial plants located along the tracks.
1.b: Schools, churches, and stores in area - has city conveniences. Adequate transportation.

2.a: Negro laborers

areaDesc.5: East end of Spring, Jamacia, Collins, Baldwin, Mckenzie, Fleetwood, Caldwell are best streets. Frazier, Gray, Troy, Italy, Duckett, are worst streets.

1.c: Distance from center of city - type of population, unpaved streets, cheap houses.
1.b: Schools and stores in area, has city conveniences.

2.a: Negro laborers

areaDesc.5: This is a typical nego area, on the outskirts of the city. Sale demand is largely for investment and when prices are bargains.

1.c: Type of population (some criminal elements) cement plant-fertilizer factory and many other small industrial plants, many unpaved strets, inadequate transportation, very poor construction
1.b: All city conveniences, school and churches in area.

2.a: Unskilled laborers

areaDesc.5: 10% type of mentioned above is located on West Commerce West of Edgefield - the reason for the increase in value shown is that since 1929 a 4 Lane highway to Fort Worth has been opened just South of this section and has resulted in a better type of people moving into this particular section,modernization and repair of properties. Part of area North of railroad and east of Edgefield contains the lower grade of population and cheaper, poorly maintained properties.

1.c: Large number of duplexes in area. Some infiltration of lower grade in part of area south of Mocking Bird lane between St. L. Railroad & Douglas Street.
1.b: All city conveniences. Adequate transportation. Schools in area. Close to business center. Dallas Country Club joins on Southeast.

2.a: Executives, business and professional men capitalists & clerical

n.6: Not sufficient rental to warrant estimate

k.3: Very few for sale practically all result of purchase of vacant lot & erection by owner of house for individual taste

areaDesc.5: 10% type above is located in Greenway Parks, one of the most beautifully platted additions in the south. It has beautiful landscaping, restricted to 1 structure per lot. Construction uniform,lot sizes large with beautiful parkways thru center of each block maintained by compulsory taxation. Part of area most likely to decline is south of Mockingbird Lane to railroad. Duplexes and apts. located from Normandy to Larchmont between Preston Road to railroad. Remainder of area uniform and substantial, North-eastern portion of area contains several expensive homes costing as much as 100,000.

1.c: Some distance to schools.
1.b: All city conveniences. Adequate transportation. Overlooks White Rock lake. Golf and country club adjoining. Stores convenient to West side. Adequate restrictions.

2.a: Clerical, executives, business and professional men

q.1: Poor because of lack of rental units

areaDesc.5: The area from Gaston Ave. to its Northern point, except about 1 block bordering Abrams Road, is considered one of the highest type residential districts of Dallas, containing several homs costing as much as $60,000. This area is well platted and contains considerable natural beauty. Along Abrams Road and south of Gaston Ave. is desirable but cheaper than remainder of area and not as well platted.

1.c: Private owned amusement park, containing swimming pool, dance pavilian, ball park and picnic grounds. Might be considered of no benefit to area in northern part. Small settlement of negroes also in northern part.
1.b: Schools and churches in area.Community business center easily accessible. Adequate transportation, except Northern part which is served by Shuttle Bus connecting with street cars which is slightly inconvenient. Area touches municipal gold course on west. Has all city conveniences.

2.a: Clerical, business executives and professional men

areaDesc.5: North end of Windomere, Edgefirls, Clinton and Winnetka and west end of Neches, 5th & 6th, Salmon Drive, Thomasson, Steward, best streets. South part of western side oldest part of area. Apartment houses located principally along Kings Highway.

1.c: Type of population - negro area.
1.b: All city conveniences

2.a: Laborers, domestics

areaDesc.5: This is a small are of negro houses - occupants largely employed as domestics in adjoining areas to west. No expansion of area.

1.c: Many unpaved street, distance from principal business center of Dallas, mixture of low price poor construction.
1.b: All city conveniences, good schools, adequate transportation. Business center in area. Close to Stevens Park and El Tivoli Golf Courses.

2.a: Clerical, Professional skilled and unskilled laborers,executives

areaDesc.5: Section east of Oak Cliff Blvd. & North of Burlington best part of area. Much new construction south of Jefferson & west of Westmoreland, also north of Jefferson between Calumet & Francis also in part of area South of G. C & S.F. Railroad, also in Western part north of Davis Street. South of Davis & north of Jefferson between Kramer & Ravinnia not so good.

1.c: Mixed type of construction, older properties transition to business center in area. Nothing but zoning restrictions in area, City Zoo in southeast corner.
1.b: All city conveniences, grade schools & high school, churches and business center in area. Adequate transportation. Parks in area.

2.a: Executives, business men, professional men, clerical, skilled and unskilled laborers

a.3: Apts.4/16 units 3/5 rs. This area also contains 2 hotel apts. in addition.

areaDesc.5: Jefferson Ave. is largely business all through area and around its intersection with Beckley and Marsalis is several blocks are included in business. Marsalis, beckley, and Bishop North of Jefferson predominate in apartments. Also many apartments in Kings Highway. Clinton,Winnetka,Willoment,Elsbeth,Zang Blvd., are better streets.The area is composed of almost every type of of property, good, bad and indifferent, single family, 2 story and apartments,cheap old houses, and more modern good houses, with predomination in older properties. As a whole the part of area North of Jefferson is better than the part South of Jefferson.

1.c: Mixtuer of population - proximity of river. Cemetery. Packing House in area, many cheap stores, street car barn in area, many unpaved streets.
1.b: Has all city conveniences, schools and churches in area. Adequate transportation.

2.a: Unskilled laborers, domestics, Packing house employees, street car employees

3.3: 25 About 5% of area is 2 sty frames & apts. 4- fam. converted 3/4 rm. units.

areaDesc.5: Cheaper properties location north of Hutchins. North of railroad east of Cliff and south of Hutchins and west of Cliff St. includes the larger better properties in the area, apartments and 2 stories.

1.c: M   d type of construction - railroad - many unpaved streets
1.b: All city conveniences, schools and churches in area. Adequate transportation.

2.a: Clerical, laborers, skilled and unskilled some business m

areaDesc.5: New construction scattered all over area, southeast, central portion and eastern edge has most activity in new building. An area without any outstanding favorable or detrimental influences - but cheaply priced.

1.c: Mixed type of construction - Unpaved streets - distance to principal business center of Oak Cliff and Dallas.
1.b: Schools, churches, stores in area. Bus transportation.

2.a: Clerical, skilled and unskilled laborers. Some busines men.

areaDesc.5: New construction in northeast and scattered all over area. Recent construction of two new schools has added stability of this area.

1.c: Heavy traffic on Gaston Avenue. Age of majority of improvements. Encroachment of apartment houses.
1.b: Adequate transportation. Grade school in area. Country Club and one small part and one large park join area. Community business center in area.

2.a: Executives, business and professional men, clerical

areaDesc.5: Northeastern part has most of smaller places and new construction. Apartments mostly on Reiger, Victor, Tremont & Worth. Monto Vista, Newell, Clermont, best streets.

1.c: Area almost entirely built up. Age of properties.
1.b: All city conveniences. Adequate transportation. Close to schools, churches, and business center. Uniform type of large, expensive homes.

2.a: Executives, business and professional men

m.1: Not sufficient rental property to establish rental property

areaDesc.5: This is the last part of a higly restricted addition to be improved, containing structures that could be classed as edifices, occupied by well to do families but on a slight down trend due to younger generation moving in areas of more modern construction.

1.c: Age of construction and lower grade area to south - some business encroachment. Encroachment of apartment houses.
1.b: Adequate transportation. Schools, churches and community business center in area. All city conveniences.

2.a: Clerical, business and professional men, skilled mechanics

areaDesc.5: East of Lindbergh and North border East of Greenville Ave. best part of area. Southwest corner worst part of area. Apartment houses scattered over entire area except from Llano to Richmond between Greenville and Lindbergh with very few West of Greenville Avenue.

6.1: Highland Park and University Park Dallas, Texas

1.e: Southern part static Northern part possible upward
1.c: Distance to Principal business center. Age of properties in Southern part of area.
1.b: All city convenience-adequate transportation-schools and stores in area. Churches in area. Southern Methodist University  in area. Dallas Country Club joins on West.

2.a: Clerical, business and professional men - executives

k.1: to 7500- Fair at price Good on new const.

areaDesc.5: Along Drexel Drive and St. Johns Drive located several large, expensive homes but old. Southern part of area original part of Highland Park and while properties are old they are still desirable. New construction largely North of Southern Methodist University, on East side of area, where several new subdivisions have been opened. Values have quite a tendency to increase in areas and North of Southern Methodist University but it is possible for values to be adversely affected by cheaper construction on the north.

1.c: None
1.b: All city conveniences. Adequate transportation. Well planned and highly restricted area. Modern business center in area. Close to schools. Dallas Country Club joins.

2.a: Executives, business, and professional men, capitilist

areaDesc.5: Major portion of this area contains beautiful parkways, ideally landscaped and maintained by promoters of the addition. It has beautiful curving streets and boulevards amply large to care for traffic. Rigidly restricted by deeds that several years yet to run.

1.c: Northeastern part some distance to transportation. Also some distance to schools, churches and stores.
1.b: Stevens Park joins on west. Wooded lots. Scenic beauty. Uniformity of construction. Shuttle bus transportation in western part. All city conveniences.

2.a: Clerical, executives, business and professional men

m.1: Only few houses for rent and these in older part which is southeast part of area. Not sufficient to estimate.

areaDesc.5: This area is well platted, containing rather rigid restrictions, exceptional natural beauty, both in contour and trees, containing several expensive houses, some two or three costing as much as $30,000.

1.c: Some distance to schools, churches and stores. Area joining on North is adjacent to Fort Worth cut off road, a heavy traffic artery lined with filling stations, small stores and tourist camps.
1.b: Stevens Park adjoining on South and East. Uniformity of construction. All city conveniences. Scenic beauty. Shuttle bus transportation. Well restricted.

2.a: Executives, salesmen, business and professional men

areaDesc.5: This is a new subdivision with majority of construction during past five years. It is well laid out, has natural scenic beauty good elevation. type of development and population offsets distance to schools, churches and stores.

1.c: Shuttle Bus transportation along Jefferson somewhat inconvenient. Distance to principal business center.
1.b: Small park playground in area. Good Senior High School joins on east. Major portion of area comparatively new. Southwestern part some distance from stores.

2.a: Clerical, business and professional men

areaDesc.5: A fairly well balanced neighborhood, largely new and with fair prospects for some further development. Southern part of area north of Jefferson is very active now with new construction, and Western part of area south of Jefferson also very active.
